SEARCH

Package com.winterhavenmc.library.messagebuilder.core.ports.pipeline.accessors

package com.winterhavenmc.library.messagebuilder.core.ports.pipeline.accessors
Provides mechanisms for extracting macro-compatible string values from objects that have been adapted by the Accessor system.

This package is responsible for converting functional adapter interfaces (such as Nameable, Locatable, Quantifiable, etc.) into a structured MacroStringMap. The keys and values produced are used to populate and resolve placeholder macros in messages built by the MessageBuilderLib pipeline.

The FieldAccessor interface defines the contract for this behavior, and the FieldAccessor class provides the default implementation, dispatching to the appropriate extractor methods based on the runtime type of both the adapter and the adapted object.

Usage Example

Once an object has been adapted to a supported interface (e.g., Nameable), the extractor will automatically invoke the correct method to produce all relevant placeholder mappings (e.g., {ENTITY.NAME}).

This layer ensures consistent population and resolution of macros across the library.

[ Alternate JavaDoc from obsolete package ]

Defines the adapter mechanism for macro value extraction within the message-building pipeline.

The Accessor interface provides a common contract for extracting structured or formatted string values from arbitrary domain objects. These values are placed into the macro resolution context and used to replace placeholders in message templates.

Built-in Accessor Support

The library provides built-in adapters for many common object types, such as:

  • Nameable — provides {OBJECT.NAME}
  • Locatable — provides {OBJECT.LOCATION}, {OBJECT.LOCATION.X}, etc.
  • Expirable and Protectable — provide DURATION and INSTANT subkeys
  • Owner, Killer, Looter, UUID, and others

Plugin Extension

Plugin developers can integrate with the macro system simply by implementing one or more of the supported adapter interfaces on their custom types (e.g., Nameable, Locatable, etc.). This allows macros like {MYOBJECT.NAME} or {MYOBJECT.LOCATION.WORLD} to be automatically resolved when passed into the message builder.

Accessor Registration and Precedence

All adapters are managed by AccessorRegistry, which maintains registration order to enforce resolution precedence. The first adapter to produce a value for a macro string wins; subsequent adapters cannot overwrite that string.

This enables library consumers to override or extend built-in behavior with plugin-defined adapters.

See Also:

    Accessor
    Defines a uniform contract for accessing structured data from objects that do not directly implement a library-specific interface.

    Enumeration of all built-in adapter types supported by the message builder pipeline.

    FieldAccessor
    Functional interface representing a strategy for extracting macro-replaceable fields from an object that has been successfully adapted by a given Accessor.
